meanings.definition: Time during which a machine, especially a computer, is not working or unavailable for use.
meanings.sent1: During the downtime, the computer screen remained blank.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't finish my work due to the unexpected downtime of the printer.
meanings.sent3: The downtime of the coffee machine led to a chaotic morning in the office.
meanings.sent4: The downtime of the server was like a power outage in the digital world.
meanings.sent5: The sudden downtime of the elevator caught everyone by surprise.

meanings.definition: Time when a person is not working or occupied.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, I enjoy some downtime watching TV.
meanings.sent2: Weekends are for relaxation and downtime away from the hustle of the week.
meanings.sent3: His idea of downtime involves fishing by the peaceful lake.
meanings.sent4: The downtime between meetings allows for a quick power nap.
meanings.sent5: Taking downtime to recharge is essential for overall well-being.
